ccnd_private.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /**
00002  * @file ccnd_private.h
00003  *
00004  * Private definitions for ccnd - the CCNx daemon.
00005  * Data structures are described here so that logging and status
00006  * routines can be compiled separately.
00007  *
00008  * Part of ccnd - the CCNx Daemon.
00009  *
00010  * Copyright (C) 2008-2013 Palo Alto Research Center, Inc.
00011  *
00012  * This work is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under
00013  * the terms of the GNU General Public License version 2 as published by the
00014  * Free Software Foundation.
00015  * This work is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY
00016  * WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or
00017  * FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License
00018  * for more details. You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public
00019  * License along with this program; if not, write to the
00020  * Free Software Foundation, Inc., 51 Franklin Street, Fifth Floor,
00021  * Boston, MA 02110-1301, USA.
00022  */

00066 /**

00075 /**
00076  * We pass this handle almost everywhere within ccnd
00077  */
00078 struct ccnd_handle {
00079     unsigned char ccnd_id[32];      /**< sha256 digest of our public key */
00080     struct hashtb *faces_by_fd;     /**< keyed by fd */
00081     struct hashtb *dgram_faces;     /**< keyed by sockaddr */
00082     struct hashtb *faceid_by_guid;  /**< keyed by guid */
00083     struct hashtb *content_tab;     /**< keyed by portion of ContentObject */
00084     struct hashtb *nameprefix_tab;  /**< keyed by name prefix components */
00085     struct hashtb *interest_tab;    /**< keyed by interest msg sans Nonce */
00086     struct hashtb *guest_tab;       /**< keyed by faceid */
00087     struct ccn_indexbuf *skiplinks; /**< skiplist for content-ordered ops */
00088     unsigned forward_to_gen;        /**< for forward_to updates */
00089     unsigned face_gen;              /**< faceid generation number */
00090     unsigned face_rover;            /**< for faceid allocation */
00091     unsigned face_limit;            /**< current number of face slots */
00092     struct face **faces_by_faceid;  /**< array with face_limit elements */
00093     struct ccn_scheduled_event *reaper;
00094     struct ccn_scheduled_event *age;
00095     struct ccn_scheduled_event *clean;
00096     struct ccn_scheduled_event *age_forwarding;
00097     const char *portstr;            /**< "main" port number */
00098     unsigned ipv4_faceid;           /**< wildcard IPv4, bound to port */
00099     unsigned ipv6_faceid;           /**< wildcard IPv6, bound to port */
00100     nfds_t nfds;                    /**< number of entries in fds array */
00101     struct pollfd *fds;             /**< used for poll system call */
00102     struct ccn_gettime ticktock;    /**< our time generator */
00103     long sec;                       /**< cached gettime seconds */
00104     unsigned usec;                  /**< cached gettime microseconds */
00105     ccn_wrappedtime wtnow;          /**< corresponding wrapped time */
00106     int sliver;                     /**< extra microseconds beyond wtnow */
00107     long starttime;                 /**< ccnd start time, in seconds */
00108     unsigned starttime_usec;        /**< ccnd start time fractional part */
00109     unsigned iserial;               /**< interest serial number (for logs) */
00110     struct ccn_schedule *sched;     /**< our schedule */
00111     struct ccn_charbuf *send_interest_scratch; /**< for use by send_interest */
00112     struct ccn_charbuf *scratch_charbuf; /**< one-slot scratch cache */
00113     struct ccn_indexbuf *scratch_indexbuf; /**< one-slot scratch cache */
00114     /** Next three fields are used for direct accession-to-content table */
00115     ccn_accession_t accession_base;
00116     unsigned content_by_accession_window;
00117     struct content_entry **content_by_accession;
00118     /** The following holds stragglers that would otherwise bloat the above */
00119     struct hashtb *sparse_straggler_tab; /* keyed by accession */
00120     ccn_accession_t accession;      /**< newest used accession number */
00121     ccn_accession_t min_stale;      /**< smallest accession of stale content */
00122     ccn_accession_t max_stale;      /**< largest accession of stale content */
00123     unsigned long capacity;         /**< may toss content if there more than
00124                                      this many content objects in the store */
00125     unsigned long n_stale;          /**< Number of stale content objects */
00126     struct ccn_indexbuf *unsol;     /**< unsolicited content */
00127     unsigned long oldformatcontent;
00128     unsigned long oldformatcontentgrumble;
00129     unsigned long oldformatinterests;
00130     unsigned long oldformatinterestgrumble;
00131     unsigned long content_dups_recvd;
00132     unsigned long content_items_sent;
00133     unsigned long interests_accepted;
00134     unsigned long interests_dropped;
00135     unsigned long interests_sent;
00136     unsigned long interests_stuffed;
00137     unsigned short seed[3];         /**< for PRNG */
00138     int running;                    /**< true while should be running */
00139     int debug;                      /**< For controlling debug output */
00140     ccnd_logger logger;             /**< For debug output */
00141     void *loggerdata;               /**< Passed to logger */
00142     int logbreak;                   /**< see ccn_msg() */
00143     unsigned long logtime;          /**< see ccn_msg() */
00144     int logpid;                     /**< see ccn_msg() */
00145     int mtu;                        /**< Target size for stuffing interests */
00146     int flood;                      /**< Internal control for auto-reg */
00147     struct ccn_charbuf *autoreg;    /**< URIs to auto-register */
00148     int force_zero_freshness;       /**< Simulate freshness=0 on all content */
00149     unsigned interest_faceid;       /**< for self_reg internal client */
00150     const char *progname;           /**< our name, for locating helpers */
00151     struct ccn *internal_client;    /**< internal client */
00152     struct face *face0;             /**< special face for internal client */
00153     struct ccn_charbuf *service_ccnb; /**< for local service discovery */
00154     struct ccn_charbuf *neighbor_ccnb; /**< for neighbor service discovery */
00155     struct ccn_seqwriter *notice;   /**< for notices of status changes */
00156     struct ccn_indexbuf *chface;    /**< faceids w/ recent status changes */
00157     struct ccn_scheduled_event *internal_client_refresh;
00158     struct ccn_scheduled_event *notice_push;
00159     unsigned data_pause_microsec;   /**< tunable, see choose_face_delay() */
00160     int (*noncegen)(struct ccnd_handle *, struct face *, unsigned char *);
00161                                     /**< pluggable nonce generation */
00162     int tts_default;                /**< CCND_DEFAULT_TIME_TO_STALE (seconds) */
00163     int tts_limit;                  /**< CCND_MAX_TIME_TO_STALE (seconds) */
00164 };
00165 
00166 /**
00167  * Each face is referenced by a number, the faceid.  The low-order
00168  * bits (under the MAXFACES) constitute a slot number that is
00169  * unique (for this ccnd) among the faces that are alive at a given time.
00170  * The rest of the bits form a generation number that make the
00171  * entire faceid unique over time, even for faces that are defunct.
00172  */
00173 #define FACESLOTBITS 18
00174 #define MAXFACES ((1U << FACESLOTBITS) - 1)
00175 
00176 struct content_queue {
00177     unsigned burst_nsec;             /**< nsec per KByte, limits burst rate */
00178     unsigned min_usec;               /**< minimum delay for this queue */
00179     unsigned rand_usec;              /**< randomization range */
00180     unsigned ready;                  /**< # that have waited enough */
00181     unsigned nrun;                   /**< # sent since last randomized delay */
00182     struct ccn_indexbuf *send_queue; /**< accession numbers of pending content */
00183     struct ccn_scheduled_event *sender;
00184 };

00187     CCN_CQ_ASAP,
00188     CCN_CQ_NORMAL,
00189     CCN_CQ_SLOW,
00190     CCN_CQ_N
00191 };

00206 /**
00207  * One of our active faces
00208  */
00209 struct face {
00210     int recv_fd;                /**< socket for receiving */
00211     unsigned sendface;          /**< faceid for sending (maybe == faceid) */
00212     int flags;                  /**< CCN_FACE_* face flags */
00213     int surplus;                /**< sends since last successful recv */
00214     unsigned faceid;            /**< internal face id */
00215     unsigned recvcount;         /**< for activity level monitoring */
00216     const unsigned char *guid;  /**< guid name for channel, shared w/ peers */
00217     struct ccn_charbuf *guid_cob; /**< content object publishing face guid */
00218     struct content_queue *q[CCN_CQ_N]; /**< outgoing content, per delay class */
00219     struct ccn_charbuf *inbuf;
00220     struct ccn_skeleton_decoder decoder;
00221     size_t outbufindex;
00222     struct ccn_charbuf *outbuf;
00223     const struct sockaddr *addr;
00224     socklen_t addrlen;
00225     int pending_interests;
00226     unsigned rrun;
00227     uintmax_t rseq;
00228     struct ccnd_meter *meter[CCND_FACE_METER_N];
00229     unsigned short pktseq;      /**< sequence number for sent packets */
00230     unsigned short adjstate;    /**< state of adjacency negotiotiation */
00231 };
00232 
00233 /** face flags */
00234 #define CCN_FACE_LINK   (1 << 0) /**< Elements wrapped by CCNProtocolDataUnit */
00235 #define CCN_FACE_DGRAM  (1 << 1) /**< Datagram interface, respect packets */
00236 #define CCN_FACE_GG     (1 << 2) /**< Considered friendly */
00237 #define CCN_FACE_LOCAL  (1 << 3) /**< PF_UNIX socket */
00238 #define CCN_FACE_INET   (1 << 4) /**< IPv4 */
00239 #define CCN_FACE_MCAST  (1 << 5) /**< a party line (e.g. multicast) */
00240 #define CCN_FACE_INET6  (1 << 6) /**< IPv6 */
00241 #define CCN_FACE_DC     (1 << 7) /**< Direct control face */
00242 #define CCN_FACE_NOSEND (1 << 8) /**< Don't send anymore */
00243 #define CCN_FACE_UNDECIDED (1 << 9) /**< Might not be talking ccn */
00244 #define CCN_FACE_PERMANENT (1 << 10) /**< No timeout for inactivity */
00245 #define CCN_FACE_CONNECTING (1 << 11) /**< Connect in progress */
00246 #define CCN_FACE_LOOPBACK (1 << 12) /**< v4 or v6 loopback address */
00247 #define CCN_FACE_CLOSING (1 << 13) /**< close stream when output is done */
00248 #define CCN_FACE_PASSIVE (1 << 14) /**< a listener or a bound dgram socket */
00249 #define CCN_FACE_NORECV (1 << 15) /**< use for sending only */
00250 #define CCN_FACE_REGOK (1 << 16) /**< Allowed to do prefix registration */
00251 #define CCN_FACE_SEQOK (1 << 17) /** OK to send SequenceNumber link messages */
00252 #define CCN_FACE_SEQPROBE (1 << 18) /** SequenceNumber probe */
00253 #define CCN_FACE_LC    (1 << 19) /** A link check has been issued recently */
00254 #define CCN_FACE_BC    (1 << 20) /** Needs SO_BROADCAST to send */
00255 #define CCN_FACE_NBC   (1 << 21) /** Don't use SO_BROADCAST to send */
00256 #define CCN_FACE_ADJ   (1 << 22) /** Adjacency guid has been negotiatied */
00257 #define CCN_NOFACEID    (~0U)    /** denotes no face */
00258 
00259 /**
00260  *  The content hash table is keyed by the initial portion of the ContentObject
00261  *  that contains all the parts of the complete name.  The extdata of the hash
00262  *  table holds the rest of the object, so that the whole ContentObject is
00263  *  stored contiguously.  The internal form differs from the on-wire form in
00264  *  that the final content-digest name component is represented explicitly,
00265  *  which simplifies the matching logic.
00266  *  The original ContentObject may be reconstructed simply by excising this
00267  *  last name component, which is easily located via the comps array.
00268  */
00269 struct content_entry {
00270     ccn_accession_t accession;  /**< assigned in arrival order */
00271     unsigned arrival_faceid;    /**< the faceid of first arrival */
00272     unsigned short *comps;      /**< Name Component byte boundary offsets */
00273     int ncomps;                 /**< Number of name components plus one */
00274     int flags;                  /**< see below */
00275     const unsigned char *key;   /**< ccnb-encoded ContentObject */
00276     int key_size;               /**< Size of fragment prior to Content */
00277     int size;                   /**< Size of ContentObject */
00278     struct ccn_indexbuf *skiplinks; /**< skiplist for name-ordered ops */
00279 };
00280 
00281 /**
00282  * content_entry flags
00283  */
00284 #define CCN_CONTENT_ENTRY_SLOWSEND  1
00285 #define CCN_CONTENT_ENTRY_STALE     2
00286 #define CCN_CONTENT_ENTRY_PRECIOUS  4
00287 
00288 /**
00289  * The sparse_straggler hash table, keyed by accession, holds scattered
00290  * entries that would otherwise bloat the direct content_by_accession table.
00291  */
00292 struct sparse_straggler_entry {
00293     struct content_entry *content;
00294 };
00295 
00296 /**
00297  * State for the strategy engine
00298  *
00299  * This is still quite embryonic.
00300  */
00301 struct ccn_strategy {
00302     struct ccn_scheduled_event *ev; /**< for time-based strategy event */
00303     int state;
00304     ccn_wrappedtime birth;          /**< when interest entry was created */
00305     ccn_wrappedtime renewed;        /**< when interest entry was renewed */
00306     unsigned renewals;              /**< number of times renewed */
00307 };
00308 
00309 struct ielinks;
00310 struct ielinks {
00311     struct ielinks *next;           /**< next in list */
00312     struct ielinks *prev;           /**< previous in list */
00313     struct nameprefix_entry *npe;   /**< owning npe, or NULL for head */
00314 };
00315 
00316 /**
00317  * The interest hash table is keyed by the interest message
00318  *
00319  * The interest message has fields that do not participate in the
00320  * similarity test stripped out - in particular the nonce.
00321  *
00322  */
00323 struct interest_entry {
00324     struct ielinks ll;
00325     struct ccn_strategy strategy;   /**< state of strategy engine */
00326     struct pit_face_item *pfl;      /**< upstream and downstream faces */
00327     struct ccn_scheduled_event *ev; /**< next interest timeout */
00328     const unsigned char *interest_msg; /**< pending interest message */
00329     unsigned size;                  /**< size of interest message */
00330     unsigned serial;                /**< used for logging */
00331 };
00332 
00333 /**
00334  * The guest hash table is keyed by the faceid of the requestor
00335  *
00336  * The cob is an answer for the request.
00337  *
00338  */
00339 struct guest_entry {
00340     struct ccn_charbuf *cob;
00341 };
00342 
00343 #define TYPICAL_NONCE_SIZE 12       /**< actual allocated size may differ */
00344 /**
00345  * Per-face PIT information
00346  *
00347  * This is used to track the pending interest info that is specific to
00348  * a face.  The list may contain up to two entries for a given face - one
00349  * to track the most recent arrival on that face (the downstream), and
00350  * one to track the most recently sent (the upstream).
00351  */
00352 struct pit_face_item {
00353     struct pit_face_item *next;     /**< next in list */
00354     unsigned faceid;                /**< face id */
00355     ccn_wrappedtime renewed;        /**< when entry was last refreshed */
00356     ccn_wrappedtime expiry;         /**< when entry expires */
00357     unsigned pfi_flags;             /**< CCND_PFI_x */
00358     unsigned char nonce[TYPICAL_NONCE_SIZE]; /**< nonce bytes */
00359 };
00360 #define CCND_PFI_NONCESZ  0x00FF    /**< Mask for actual nonce size */
00361 #define CCND_PFI_UPSTREAM 0x0100    /**< Tracks upstream (sent interest) */
00362 #define CCND_PFI_UPENDING 0x0200    /**< Has been sent upstream */
00363 #define CCND_PFI_SENDUPST 0x0400    /**< Should be sent upstream */
00364 #define CCND_PFI_UPHUNGRY 0x0800    /**< Upstream hungry, cupboard bare */
00365 #define CCND_PFI_DNSTREAM 0x1000    /**< Tracks downstream (recvd interest) */
00366 #define CCND_PFI_PENDING  0x2000    /**< Pending for immediate data */
00367 #define CCND_PFI_SUPDATA  0x4000    /**< Suppressed data reply */
00368 #define CCND_PFI_DCFACE  0x10000    /**< This upstream is a DC face */
00369 
00370 /**
00371  * The nameprefix hash table is keyed by the Component elements of
00372  * the Name prefix.
00373  */
00374 struct nameprefix_entry {
00375     struct ielinks ie_head;      /**< list head for interest entries */
00376     struct ccn_indexbuf *forward_to; /**< faceids to forward to */
00377     struct ccn_indexbuf *tap;    /**< faceids to forward to as tap */
00378     struct ccn_forwarding *forwarding; /**< detailed forwarding info */
00379     struct nameprefix_entry *parent; /**< link to next-shorter prefix */
00380     int children;                /**< number of children */
00381     unsigned flags;              /**< CCN_FORW_* flags about namespace */
00382     int fgen;                    /**< used to decide when forward_to is stale */
00383     unsigned src;                /**< faceid of recent content source */
00384     unsigned osrc;               /**< and of older matching content */
00385     unsigned usec;               /**< response-time prediction */
00386 };
00387 
00388 /**
00389  * Keeps track of the faces that interests matching a given name prefix may be
00390  * forwarded to.
00391  */
00392 struct ccn_forwarding {
00393     unsigned faceid;             /**< locally unique number identifying face */
00394     unsigned flags;              /**< CCN_FORW_* - c.f. <ccn/reg_mgnt.h> */
00395     int expires;                 /**< time remaining, in seconds */
00396     struct ccn_forwarding *next;
00397 };

00404 void ccnd_meter_init(struct ccnd_handle *h, struct ccnd_meter *m, const char *what);

00413 /**
00414  * Refer to doc/technical/Registration.txt for the meaning of these flags.
00415  *
00416  * @def CCN_FORW_ACTIVE         1
00417  * @def CCN_FORW_CHILD_INHERIT  2
00418  * @def CCN_FORW_ADVERTISE      4
00419  * @def CCN_FORW_LAST           8
00420  * @def CCN_FORW_CAPTURE       16
00421  * @def CCN_FORW_LOCAL         32
00422  * @def CCN_FORW_TAP           64
00423  * @def CCN_FORW_CAPTURE_OK   128
00424  */
00425 #define CCN_FORW_PFXO (CCN_FORW_ADVERTISE | CCN_FORW_CAPTURE | CCN_FORW_LOCAL)
00426 #define CCN_FORW_REFRESHED      (1 << 16) /**< private to ccnd */
00427

00430  * Determines how frequently we age our forwarding entries
00431  */
00432 #define CCN_FWU_SECS 5
